title: Comet

nouns: A block of ice and dust that orbits the sun. Seen from the earth, it looks like a bright star with a tail.
A celestial phenomenon with the appearance given by the orbiting celestial body.
(astronomy) a relatively small extraterrestrial body consisting of a frozen mass that travels around the sun in a highly elliptical orbit
Comets are small astronomical objects similar to asteroids but composed largely of ice.
A celestial body, generally with a tail.
A comet is an icy small Solar System body that, when passing close to the Sun, heats up and begins to outgas, displaying a visible atmosphere or coma, and sometimes also a tail.

description:
A comet, an icy, rocky space object that can form a tail of gas and dust when near the sun. Generally depicted as an icy-blue comet, as if streaking downwards in a night sky.

May be used for meteors and other celestial bodies, as well as for content concerning space more generally. Also occasionally used for flair or flourish.

apple_vendor_description: The comet emoji on Apple devices streaks across the digital cosmos with a luminous, icy tail that glows with an ethereal blue and white light, a testament to Apple's masterful use of gradients and realistic lighting. Its core is a dark, rocky mass, sharply defined with the soft, rounded edges typical of Apple's emoji design. This celestial traveler on Apple devices can represent a fleeting moment, a sudden inspiration, or an extraordinary event.
